Shahjalal Hall | Sthapattyacharjo Muzharul Islam
Shahjalal Hall, Chittagong University.
Architecture by Sthapattyacharjo Muzharul Islam.

As an architectural photographer, it brings me immense joy to share some of the images I have captured over time, commemorating the significant legacy of Muzharul Islam. Delving into his works has been a profound journey for me. It is not merely about capturing structures; rather, it involves unraveling the essence of his vision, understanding the nuances of Tropical Modern Architecture, and perceiving the profound impact of his holistic approach to design.
With the assistance of Archiconnect, this venture has been a learning experience, shaping my perspective and enabling me to interpret Sir’s work through my own eyes. I am not only preserving visual records but also contributing to the broader narrative of architectural history. This journey stands as a lifetime documentation for me, and I am committed to sharing all facets of Muzharul Islam’s brilliance that I have had the privilege to capture.
I seek your prayers and blessings as I continue this exploration, hoping that my work adds to the collective understanding of Muzharul Islam’s monumental contributions to the field of architecture.
Photography by Prantography / Junaid Hasan Pranto
